title: GAIA: Turn local shopping into a movement
summary: Small businesses lack visibility and access to innovative tools, while consumers face privacy risks and struggle to make sustainable choices in their everyday shopping.
solution: Gaia is the first platform that turns your shopping habits into a game, empowering local businesses and rewarding your sustainable choices.
proposer_relevant_experience:
Álvaro Liébana Carrascosa (CEO and Blockchain architect)

Mainly focus on the blockchain and data encryption side, designing its architecture and implementing the system’s core logic.

As CEO, I am also responsible for shaping the company’s strategy, defining its vision and goals, and leading business development and partnerships.

[https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/alvaro\-liebana\-carrascosa\-898a67254/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alvaro-liebana-carrascosa-898a67254/)

David Hostalrich Jato (CTO)

Primarily focused on off-chain development, including the mobile application, its architecture, and integrations with external services. UX/UI Design.

[https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/david\-hostalrich\-jato\-2abaaa209/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-hostalrich-jato-2abaaa209/)

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
GAIA is fundamentally different from existing solutions. It is not just a digital receipt wallet or another reward platform, it is a visibility engine for local commerce, transforming everyday purchases into an interactive and gamified experience. Through a Season Pass, small shops can showcase products, stories, and promotions, turning physical shopping into a rewarding journey that builds lasting, healthy habits rather than speculation.

Web3-focused alternatives like VeChain’s GreenCart, NanoAct, or Scannit target mostly crypto-native users and rely heavily on token incentives, with blockchain used primarily for simple airdrop or reward mechanics.

Meanwhile, Web2 competitors struggle with poor technology, low data accuracy, and intrusive data collection models.

GAIA bridges these two worlds with a frictionless, Web2-friendly experience that fully embraces core blockchain principles:

-End-to-end encryption, powered by a Diffie-Hellman–based architecture



-True data sovereignty, decentralizing access to purchase information



-Zero-knowledge proofs enabling private, verifiable returns and compliance workflows



-No personal data required, and no added friction for everyday users



GAIA brings blockchain to ordinary people through meaningful, daily interactions, not speculation.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Our prototype will demonstrate that blockchain can be part of everyday life, even for people with no technical background. It shows that its value goes far beyond DeFi or tokenization, proving that blockchain can improve simple, practical routines.



Through a simple mobile app, users will experience private, verifiable and gamified digital receipts, ownership of data, automatic reminders for return and warranty periods, a personal history of purchases, and access to a new, privacy preserving rewards system designed to support local businesses.



All core features will be available to everyone who downloads the app. In our initial city, users will also enjoy the full set of local interactions: personalized offers, participation in the Season Pass gamification, and partner shop rewards. These location based features will be progressively rolled out to new regions and countries as we expand.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Measuring our success with on-chain metrics is straightforward. In GAIA, every purchase has the potential to generate a blockchain transaction, a powerful indicator of real world adoption. While this represents a huge long term opportunity, we remain realistic about the early stages.



Over the estimated 9 month pilot period, we expect to achieve 50,000 on-chain mainnet transactions, driven by receipt registrations, merchant-issued receipt events, and verifiable proofs for returns and guarantees.



We also track unique and active users. To validate GAIA as a real use case, our goal is to reach 1,000 active users during the pilot, with a clear path toward 10,000 users as the project expands. For a controlled launch environment, these are realistic numbers that can demonstrate strong traction and set the foundation for something bigger.



These metrics will give us a precise, transparent view of the project’s growth and real world impact..

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Our solution brings a new approach to strengthening local commerce: we gamify the shopping experience to encourage more sustainable consumer habits while giving small businesses a powerful new visibility channel.



To put it in context, we address the problem from two angles, consumers and local merchants.



For consumers, we introduce a Season Pass, similar to those found in popular video games, with levels from 0 to 100. Users earn points based on the sustainability of their purchases, measured through eight KPIs such as product proximity, sustainable production, and energy-efficient operations. The more sustainable their choices, the faster they progress through the Season Pass and earn better rewards.



For merchants, the current marketing reality is simple: visibility ends at the corner of their street. Our system changes that.

The Season Pass becomes a large, dynamic showcase where shops can present their products, stories, and promotions to a much wider audience. This gives local businesses a new discovery channel that normally would not be accessible to them, helping them compete with large digital platforms in a fair and meaningful way.



By aligning consumer incentives with merchant visibility, our solution directly tackles the core problem for everyone.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
We understand that within the Cardano ecosystem, governance is a central pillar.



That's why our approach places the Cardano community at the heart of the project. We will offer exclusive discounts and benefits for Cardano users, and we will integrate a governance layer where the community will have real influence over key decisions of our project. Our goal is to make Cardano members active stakeholders, not passive observers, something we wish more projects would embrace.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our team is highly qualified  to deliver this project with high levels of trust and accountability. Both of us are telecommunications engineers with extensive experience in development and product design, which gives us the technical and practical expertise to execute this project reliably.



This idea has been carefully matured over time; we are not starting from scratch. We have already developed key components of the system and a solid architecture, demonstrating our ability to plan and execute complex solutions. Our long standing passion for blockchain is supported by 4-5 years of studying and piloting projects across Ethereum, IOTA, and Algorand.



To ensure feasibility and accountability, we follow structured processes: defining clear milestones, maintaining transparent development documentation, and testing each component in real-world conditions.

sub_fields.title: Project Milestones
sub_fields.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
sub_fields.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Private and Decentralized Receipt Management

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: This milestone lays the foundation of the project. We will develop a mobile app that scans purchase receipts, digitizes them with AI, and handles privately encrypted receipts secured through Diffie‑Hellman, enabling decentralized access via the Cardano blockchain.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Success for this milestone is defined by the launch of the application, enabling users to upload purchase receipts to our decentralized platform. Receipts are securely encrypted and can only be decrypted by their owners through their wallet.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Evidence will be the application itself, which anyone can install on their mobile device (Android and IOS), along with the first transactions decentralized purchase receipts generated through our app!

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: POS Integration

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: It is important that merchants can issue receipts directly from their terminals. To enable this, we will develop integrations with two of the most popular commerce platforms, Shopify and Odoo, allowing merchants to start sending purchase receipts. Additionally, we will enable them to send discounts to potential customers through our app.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: With merchants able to issue receipts to consumers through GAIA, we expect hundreds of users at this stage, who can securely receive, view, and redeem discounts via the app, experiencing decentralized and private transactions.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: The way to demonstrate this is simple. We would consider this metric successful with around 100 active users, 1,000 receipts, and tracking metrics such as returns, discounts redeemed, and receipts issued directly by merchants.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Gamification System and Seasonal Pass

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: In this stage, we will develop the core of the project: the gamification system. This includes designing the system architecture, implementing the smart contract logic, and integrating KPIs to evaluate the sustainability of each receipt. Merchants will begin advertising their products or promotions through the new seasonal pass, which will be created during this stage.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Success is defined by being able to see a well-designed seasonal pass featuring local neighborhood merchants advertising their products or discounts. These will be available in the region of the initial pilot, and later more regions will be added with new merchant connections and additional discounts.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Deployment of the smart contract, tokenization of sustainability points for each purchase to prevent hacks, and transactions derived from the levels achieved in the seasonal pass, all managed by the smart contract.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Core Development & Engineering: Full stack design (server design, commerce integration, POS, and mobile app design).

40,000 ADA



Smart Contract Design: Development and design of the smart contract logic.

25,000 ADA



UX/UI Design

10,000 ADA



Audits: Security and code audits for smart contracts and the platform.

15,000 ADA



Testing & Infrastructure: Testnet/mainnet deployment, hosting, server setup, and comprehensive testing.

10,000 ADA

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
Very few projects today truly push the technical capabilities of the Cardano blockchain. Our goal is to take those capabilities to their limits, significantly increasing TPS and demonstrating that Cardano can power highly scalable, everyday applications. This is essential for attracting Web2 users into Web3 and showing them how governance, smart contracts, and decentralized infrastructure can be used seamlessly and without friction.



In our model, every purchase can become an on-chain transaction. This means our project has the potential to increase network usage, which directly benefits the ecosystem by strengthening its utility, visibility, and economic activity.
